subject: Fashion
title: Why Men Stopped Wearing Heels
description: A 60-second lesson on Why Men Stopped Wearing Heels.

hook.text: High heels were invented for men. Persian cavalry wore them to keep their feet in stirrups.

buildup.text: European aristocrats adopted heels in the 1600s. Louis XIV's favorite pair was red.

discovery.text: Women started wearing heels to borrow masculine power. Both genders strutted in platforms.

twist.text: During the Enlightenment, men abandoned 'irrational' fashion. Heels became women-only by the 1800s.

climax.text: A shoe designed for war became a symbol of femininityâ€”purely because men decided to stop wearing it.

punchline.text: Heels were masculine. Men just forgot first.

quiz.question: What was the original purpose of high heels?
options: To make women look taller at royal courts
To help Persian horsemen keep their feet in stirrups
To protect feet from muddy streets in Europe
